newsitem.title: UK: Texaco says NSea Captain restart date unclear.
newsitem.headline: Texaco says NSea Captain restart date unclear.

text.p: Texaco Inc said on Monday it was unclear when pumping would restart at its North Sea Captain field after a collision between the production vessel and a shuttle tanker.
"We don't know when it will come back up, there is an investigation team out there right now," a company spokesman said.

Work at the floating production, storage and offloading vessel in Scotland's Moray Firth was suspended last Tuesday after the collision with the shuttle tanker "Aberdeen" as oil was transhipped for delivery to the Nigg terminal.
The impact damaged some equipment aboard the FPSO and caused superficial harm to the tanker, the spokesman said.
"It's hard to say how long the field will be down without knowing the cause of the accident," he added. "There is some minor repair work envisaged."

The Captain field came on stream in March and has been running at an average of 30,000 barrels per day. Production was expected to peak at around 63,000 bpd by the end of the third quarter, Texaco said.
